SEARCH
Module FloWeekTracker
Package com.floweektracker.tasksDatabase

Class TasksDatabaseManager

java.lang.Object
com.floweektracker.tasksDatabase.TasksDatabaseManager
Direct Known Subclasses:
TasksDatabaseUI
public class TasksDatabaseManager extends Object
Representing the manager for the task names database, which saves, loads and sorts task names in the tasksListFile. It is the base class for the TasksDatabaseUI.

Fields:
  • tasksList - a TreeSet containing Strings representing the task names
  • gson - a Gson reference used to save and load tasks from the tasksListFile
  • tasksListFile - a File reference providing access to the TasksList.json file
Methods:
  • addTaskToList(String) - adds a task to the tasksList and tasksListFile
  • deleteTaskFromList(String) - deletes a task from the tasksList and tasksListFile
Getters: getTasksList()

  • Field Details

    • tasksList

      private TreeSet<String> tasksList
      Contains a String representing the task names. They are sorted alphabetically by the TasksListComparator.
      See Also:
      • TasksDatabaseManager()
      • addTaskToList(String)
      • deleteTaskFromList(String)
      • getTasksList()

    • gson

      private final com.google.gson.Gson gson
      Contains a GsonBuilder used in the addTaskToList(String) and deleteTaskFromList(String) methods to add and remove task names from the tasksListFile. It is also used in the TasksDatabaseManager constructor to load task names from the tasksListFile.

    • tasksListFile

      private final File tasksListFile
      Provides access to the TasksList.json file which contains task names from the tasksList.
      See Also:
      • TasksDatabaseManager()
      • addTaskToList(String)
      • deleteTaskFromList(String)

  • Constructor Details

    • TasksDatabaseManager

      public TasksDatabaseManager()
      Constructs a new TasksDatabaseManager instance. This constructor initializes the gson and tasksListFile references. It then checks whether the tasksListFile exists. If it does,the content from this file is loaded into the tasksList and sorted alphabetically by the TasksListComparator. Otherwise, a new TreeSet instance is created.

      May produce an exception. If it does, the JDialog with information will be shown to the user. The expected structure of the TasksList.json file is a JSON array of task name strings.
      See Also:
      • TaskDialogUI(java.util.HashMap, SingleTaskManager)
      • TasksDatabaseUI
      • Main.showErrorDialog(String, String)

  • Method Details

    • addTaskToList

      void addTaskToList(String task)
      Adds a task to the tasksList and updates the tasksListFile. It checks whether the task is successfully added to the tasksList. If it is, this task is then saved in the tasksListFile.

      May produce an exception. If it does, the JDialog with information will be shown to the user. The expected structure of the TasksList.json file is a JSON array of task name strings.
      Parameters:
      task - a String representing a task name entered by the user
      See Also:
      • TasksDatabaseListeners.createButtonsListener()
      • Main.showErrorDialog(String, String)

    • deleteTaskFromList

      void deleteTaskFromList(String task)
      Deletes a task from the tasksList and updates the tasksListFile. It checks whether the task is successfully removed from the tasksList. If it is, this task is then removed from the tasksListFile.

      May produce an exception. If it does, the JDialog with information will be shown to the user. The expected structure of the TasksList.json file is a JSON array of task name strings.
      Parameters:
      task - a String representing a task name entered by the user
      See Also:
      • TasksDatabaseListeners.createButtonsListener()
      • Main.showErrorDialog(String, String)

    • getTasksList

      public String[] getTasksList()
      Returns:
      an array of the Strings representing the task names from the tasksList.
      See Also:
      • TaskDialogUI(java.util.HashMap, SingleTaskManager)
      • TasksDatabaseListeners.createButtonsListener()
      • TasksDatabaseUI()
